the part that blew my mind last night as I was going to bed - even though I heard it and could explain it to someone else right after the stream

is the fact that because of how the  platform works they can do something no other platform can.

the server and the game clients are all the same computer - meaning when they say they can kill loading screens. They litterally mean everything can already be rendered on the server side of the code. The client doesn’t actually need to render, only act as a window to the already rendered models.

Thus an MMO the size of skyrim could have no loading screens whatsoever. because instead of the server just storing data like positioning, what’s in your inventory etc. IT is able to handle ALL of it, and what you see for the client is just a “view”
do you all have a link to the filter thing that talks about it? curious to read up on this more

If they are able to remove loading screens from Skyrim, you could beat the game in half the amount of time haha. But again, and maybe this is just my lack of knowledge of networking and our current infrastrcutre, but how can it be feasible for most people due to network speed, etc? The figure I saw thrown around was all you need is a 50mbps connection and your basically good to go. Is that something that most people have? Sure if people have fiber that's fine, but then don't most people just have fiber for like 99% of the way and the last leg is something more standard that then could throttle it?
just a second
<https://techcrunch.com/2018/09/12/europe-to-push-for-one-hour-takedown-law-for-terrorist-content/>
The next thing will the the fingerprint on our identity card
will be there in the next couple of years :disappointed:

you are correct that if you have a higher bandwidth the quality will be better. but if you don’t have 50mbps they can scale to your connection speed.
reduce quality to still provide a good playable experience.

For example if you’re on less than 50mbps -kill surround sound audio fallback to stereo or even mono if speed is bad enough there’s even different audio streaming tricks that can be done too -  that alone saves a lot of data I’m sure.

Video they can scale quality just like with youtube videos, only they can be more intelligent about it.
for example say you were playing starcraft, the whole lower third of the screen is a fixed position element. you can keep that whole area static and only update it when changes are actually seen.
with video you don’t have that kinda control because the video maker isn’t telling the streaming platform what regions are going to remain mostly static. with games developers can do that.
Here is the proposal in detail: <https://ec.europa.eu/commission/sites/beta-political/files/soteu2018-preventing-terrorist-content-online-regulation-640_en.pdf>

True yeah, they will probably have a more "economic" mode for those with iffier connections. But yeah, I assume their constantly brainstorming ways to save resources and coming up with little tricks to do exactly what you said

is it alive?

So I usually help out on our local HUG site and i just saw the new platform they moved them to (splashthat). Just curious if anyone else thinks its a terrible move. There is literally ZERO ability to customize anything or create something unique (well, there is the ability, but it looks like HS stripped that away from the end users to be able to do it)
Huh?
its not a standard cos portal?
I’ve passed this feedback on to our HUG program manager, I’ll let you know if she has any thoughts on this or if it’s something we can act on
not sure why alanis morissette gifs were not presented

Yea its not the standard COS anymore, they used to use it but starting soon, they are moving all HUGs to the splashthat site. I mean its cool and all, but it really is limited to what those HUGs can do as they stripped away some features like template creation or editing. Which I totally understand if they are looking for everyone to be uniform, but it just seems like it would be better if they just moved back to using the COS as they lose the contacts and smart content and all that jazz

She said if you want to provide direct feedback, best place she can be reached is at `<mailto:hugs@HubSpot.com|hugs@HubSpot.com>`.  No action required if this was what you had since that’s been passed along already but just wanted to close the loop here
How ironic.
:bomb:
Ah perfect, ill send some feedback to that email
Who would'a have thought of that?
